slides.title: Building Models
slides.content:
# Building Models ğŸ”§

```python_not
import torch
import torch.nn as nn

class Net(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super().__init__()
        self.fc1 = nn.Linear(784, 128)
        self.fc2 = nn.Linear(128, 10)
    
    def forward(self, x):
        x = torch.relu(self.fc1(x))
        return self.fc2(x)

model = Net()
criterion = nn.CrossEntropyLoss()
optimizer = torch.optim.Adam(model.parameters())
```

slides.title: Training Loop
slides.content:
# Training Loop ğŸ”„

```python_not
for epoch in range(epochs):
    for batch in dataloader:
        X, y = batch
        
        # Forward
        outputs = model(X)
        loss = criterion(outputs, y)
        
        # Backward
        optimizer.zero_grad()
        loss.backward()
        optimizer.step()
```

> ğŸ¯ Explicit training loop = full control!
